Package com.fdmgroup.spring.timothy_chai_ecommerce_project.controller

Class CustomerController

java.lang.Object
com.fdmgroup.spring.timothy_chai_ecommerce_project.controller.CustomerController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/customer") @Transactional(readOnly=false) public class CustomerController extends Object
This class is the customer controller that handles all the requests related to the customer.

  • Method Details

    • index

      @GetMapping("/") public String index()
      This method is used to handle the index page of the customer.
      Returns:
      the index page of the customer

    • registerCustomer

      @GetMapping("/register-customer") public String registerCustomer()
      This method is used to handle the register-customer request.
      Returns:
      the registerCustomer view

    • loginCustomer

      @GetMapping("/login") public String loginCustomer()
      This method is used to handle the login request
      Returns:
      the customerLogin view

    • processRegistration

      @PostMapping("/registration") public String processRegistration(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      This method is used to process the customer registration form. It retrieves the form parameters and creates a new customer object. It then saves the customer to the database and displays a "registration complete" message.
      Parameters:
      request - the HTTP request object
      Returns:
      the "complete" page after registering the customer

    • processLogin

      @PostMapping("/login-customer") public String processLogin(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      This method is used to process the customer login form. It retrieves the form parameters and checks if the username and password match an existing customer in the database. If the login is successful, the customer's information is stored in the session and the user is redirected to the product dashboard. If the login fails, the user is redirected back to the customer login page.
      Parameters:
      request - the HTTP request object
      Returns:
      the view to be displayed after login. If login is successful, user is redirected to the product dashboard.

    • addToCart

      @PostMapping("/addToCart") public String addToCart(@SessionAttribute Customer customer, int productId, @RequestParam int quantity)
      This method is used to add an item to the cart. It retrieves the customer information from the session, adds the item to the cart, updates the cart, and saves the customer information. Then it redirects the user to the product dashboard.
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer information
      productId - the product ID
      quantity - the quantity of the item
      Returns:
      the redirect to the product dashboard

    • removeFromCart

      @PostMapping("/removeFromCart") public String removeFromCart(@SessionAttribute Customer customer, @RequestParam int productID, @RequestParam("productQuantity") int quantity)
      This method is used to remove an item from the cart. It retrieves the customer information from the session, removes the item from the cart, updates the cart, and saves the customer information. Then it redirects the user to the product dashboard.
      Parameters:
      customer - the customer information
      productID - the product ID
      quantity - the quantity of the item to be removed
      Returns:
      the redirect to the product dashboard

    • updateCartItemQuantity

      @PostMapping("/updateCartItemQuantity") public String updateCartItemQuantity(@SessionAttribute Customer customer, @RequestParam int productID, @RequestParam("updateQuantity") String direction)
